FuncDef: The display multicast ip fib port-info command displays entries of a specified multicast group and information about the outbound interfaces of both Layer 2 and Layer 3 services. The display multicast ip fib port-info command displays entries of a specified multicast group and information about the outbound interfaces of both Layer 2 and Layer 3 services.
CLIs: display multicast ip fib [ vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> ] group <group-address> source <source-address> port-info

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a VPN instance. If this parameter is not specified, public network entries are displayed.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, which do not contain spaces. The VPN instance name cannot be _public_. The character string can contain spaces if it is enclosed with double quotation marks (").

Displays forwarding information corresponding to the specified multicast group address.
The value ranges from 224.0.0.0 to 239.255.255.255, in dotted decimal notation.

Displays multicast forwarding entries of the specified multicast source address.
The value ranges from 0.0.0.0 to 223.255.255.255, in dotted decimal notation.

Examples: <HUAWEI> display multicast ip fib group 225.0.0.1 source 100.1.1.2 port-info
